main: ^Ati-Atihan is a Philippine festival held annually in January in honor of the Santo Niño (Holy Child or Infant Jesus). It is celebrated in Aklan. The name Ati-Atihan means "to imitate the Ati people" or “to be like Atis or Aetas (Aklan Province’s natives).”

c-0: ^The street parade is known as Sadsad, which is also what the locals call their way of dancing where the foot is momentarily dragged along the ground in tune to the beat played by the marching bands.  It is known as the "Mother of All Philippine Festivals.".
